result.execSummary:
The defendant Hunter Storm Court was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Hunter Storm Court is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Hunter Storm Court was found guilty of Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If after 12 months the defendant has paid the fine and costs in full and has had no criminal violations, the defendant may petition the court for Expungement under 973.015.
*Submit DNA sample and pay surcharges. *Payment Plan:  $50.00 per month, commencing in August.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Hunter Storm Court

defendant.name: Court, Hunter Storm
defendant.address: E7990 State Road 54, New London, WI 54961

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Marquette County DNA Proof of Submission

Defendant Hunter Storm Court in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Atty Hendee states plea agreement to Ct. 1.  Ct. 2 to be dismissed.  Atty Hendee has no objection to expunge after 12 months with conditions.
Atty Gumz agrees.  Defendant agrees.    Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Atty Gumz enters a No Contest plea.  Court questions defendant regarding plea.  Defendant agrees.
Atty Hendee relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.  No objection by Atty Gumz.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of Ct. 1.  Ct. 2 to be dismissed.

Atty Hendee asks the court to follow the joint recommendation.  Parties stipulate to the year period for expungment.
Atty Gumz agrees and makes sentencing arguments.

BY THE COURT:  Ct. 1:  Pay fine and costs = $442.00
  DNA Sample + $200.00 Surcharge
Ct. 2 to be dismissed.
  Defendant agrees to the $15.00 payment plan fee.
Payment Plan:  $50.00/month commencing in August
 
 If after 12 months the defendant has paid the fine and costs and surcharge in full and has had no criminal violations, the defendant may petition the court for Expungement 973.015.
Return date on June 15, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Hunter Storm Court in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Atty Hendee states that bond needs to be set along with booking.
  Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.    Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant understands.   Court confirms the defendant's address.  Court finds probable cause to support the charges.

  BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.

  Atty Hendee has no objection to a signature bond with conditions.
  BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $500 Signature bond with conditions:
*Appear for booking today

Court questions the defendant.  Defendant wants to get an Attorney
BY THE COURT:  Set for Return; defendant would like to get an Attorney.
  Return date scheduled for June 15, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
